intro: Dictyospermum montanum, commonly known as the mountain dictyospermum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent corona. It is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
